page.title: 18TRANSPORT SYSTEMS
page.content: Being a busy industrial region the area is quite well served with a good transport network.There is a main road that runs through the area,the {B5296.}This is a very busy road and carries alot of lorries taking materials to and from the{British {Steel Plant}as well as the other industies found on the{Derwent Howe site. Most of the other roads are just service roads providing access to the large housing estate or the industrial estates of the area. The main{West Cumbrian railway line also passes through the area,and although it is not a busy line it does carry both freight and passengers. It follows the coastline as here is the flatest land with gentle gradients. There used to be many{mineral railway {lines}in the area serving the port of Workington and the steel works.
